message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.LO, cs.PL. 

The paper deals with the theoretical aspects of blockchains and their consistency criteria, which are related to distributed computing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also discusses the security aspects of blockchains, which could place it in cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The use of abstract data types and consistency criteria could also relate to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.PL (Programming Languages). Finally, the paper's focus on formal guarantees and theoretical aspects could place it in cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science).
